title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
unknow history, no water damage..
board alone:

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: no short found..

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: What about 3V8_AON and other coils?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
ok one of the usb-c|(near  hdmi port) show charge just on one side...if i upside-down the charger is not show nothing..
can it be UG400? even if it just one of the sides? or there is mosfet for each side?
no short on this area..

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
CD3217 chips use internal MOSFETs pair to control the power rail.
Check diode mode to ground on the CC1/2 pins.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: CC1/2 - both-590

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: UPC_BUSPOWER full short..001...maybe..

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
UPC2_BUSPOWER seems to be tied to ground (RG421).

Check diode mode to ground on all JG600's pins; compare with good board, if possible.
Remove USB-C connector from chassis and inspect its terminals.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: All JG600's are o.k..

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: USB-C meter stays black (no indication at all), when connect power in that port?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: look like it short...very low light lashing at the voltmeter...but again just on JG600 and just on one of the sides

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
When change the direction, some pins interchange their position.
CC1/2 and SBU1/2 are first to check.
Data lines only interchange the channels; VBUS don't change (as ground too).

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OUIqvrOPqu5CUDeYcu12n76m5rF36A6X/view?usp=share_link[/URL]

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: so what i need to looking for?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
"CC1/2 and SBU1/2 are first to check."
Did you compare diode mode readings on these lines?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
im checking just on JG600 (the problem is just on this port)

USBC2_SBU1- 615
USBC2-SBU2- 615

USBC2-CC2-CONN - 592
USBC2-CC1-CONN - 597

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
Maybe is better to insist on the other ports first.

If restart when goes to 20V, possibly problem on a secondary voltage.
Which should appear when board tries to boot.

Any chance to test with Magsafe 3 charger?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
Magsafe 3:
without battery orang light of 1 sec then of to 1 sec and then on and stay...
PPBUS-12v
with battery the orange light flashing on/off all the time..

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
Check other voltages on the board, with Magsafe 3.
3V8_AON and small coils around PMUs, U7700/8100.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
3V8_AON 3.8v
AWAKE 0V no short
PPVDD 0v no short

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: Did you check voltage on all coils around U7700/8100?

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
U8100:
PP1V2_S2 1.2v
All the rest is 0v

U7700:
PP1V8_S2 1.8v
All the rest 0v

No short found.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: Check U7700/8100 LDOS voltages.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
There is just 1 LDO on U8100, PP1V8_S2SW_CLVR_VDDC1_LDO - 0v
"all" the rest LDO'S on the board:
PP3V3_UPC1/2_LDO 3.3v
PPVDD_LDO_NAND0_OCARINA 1.5v
PP5V_S2_HDMI_LDO 5v
P5VS2TPS_PWR_EN_R_LDO 1.9v
PP1V5_P1V8VDDH_LDO15 0v no short.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message: the orange light on the charger ON then OFF for 2-3sec then ON and stay stable...

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
You have various LDOs on U8100; VLDO1/2/4/5/1V8/1V2.
Should be good to check there VCORE too.

Each VLDO has its corresponding VIN_LDO; check them also.

title: 820-02100 charging pulsing..
message:
May have problems with M1, or SSD.

But there should still be something wrong on the USB-C area of the port with strange behavior.
Compare diode mode readings on more components; between different ports.
